title._content: [Portrait of Howard McGhee, Brick Fleagle, and Miles Davis, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Howard McGhee, Brick Fleagle, and Miles Davis, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Roamed Be-bop Alley, sometimes known as 52nd St., for the last word in theory on the last word in music. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 216 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Posin'," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 19 (Sept. 10, 1947), p. 6. Subjects: McGhee, Howard, 1918- Fleagle, Brick Davis, Miles Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Trumpet players--1940-1950. Guitarists--1940-1950. Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.05741 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 0574
